alert.note: Alert for Inland Northern Brevard; Mainland Northern Brevard; Orange (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 12:52PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Brevard and east central Orange Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Christmas, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Titusville and Christmas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Inland Northern Brevard; Mainland Northern Brevard; Orange
